comment:
* A Cursor implementation that exposes results from a query on a
 * {@link SQLiteDatabase}.
 *
 * SQLiteCursor is not internally synchronized so code using a SQLiteCursor from multiple
 * threads should perform its own synchronization when using the SQLiteCursor.

variables.name: mEditTable
variables.comment: The name of the table to edit

variables.name: mColumns
variables.comment: The names of the columns in the rows

variables.name: mQuery
variables.comment: The query object for the cursor

variables.name: mDriver
variables.comment: The compiled query this cursor came from

variables.name: mCount
variables.comment: The number of rows in the cursor

variables.name: mCursorWindowCapacity
variables.comment: The number of rows that can fit in the cursor window, 0 if unknown

variables.name: mColumnNameMap
variables.comment: A mapping of column names to column indices, to speed up lookups

variables.name: mFillWindowForwardOnly
variables.comment: Controls fetching of rows relative to requested position *

methods.name: public SQLiteDatabase getDatabase()
methods.comment:
* Get the database that this cursor is associated with.
     * @return the SQLiteDatabase that this cursor is associated with.

methods.name: public boolean onMove(int oldPosition, int newPosition)
public void setSelectionArguments(String[] selectionArgs)
methods.comment: * Changes the selection arguments. The new values take effect after a call to requery().

methods.name: public void setFillWindowForwardOnly(boolean fillWindowForwardOnly)
methods.comment:
* Controls fetching of rows relative to requested position. * *

Calling this method defines how rows will be loaded, but it doesn't affect rows that * are already in the window. This setting is preserved if a new window is * {@link #setWindow(CursorWindow) set} * * @param fillWindowForwardOnly if true, rows will be fetched starting from requested position * up to the window's capacity. Default value is false.

methods.name: protected void finalize()
methods.comment: * Release the native resources, if they haven't been released yet.

methodNames: public boolean onMove(int oldPosition, int newPosition)
